0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement                    (Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.45
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                      2       2.              COPY  VCATNOTE
                                       3             =*
                                       4             =* VCAT - offline VBLD assembly
                                       5             =*
                                       6             =* This assembly of FILEVCAT is for linking to the offline progarm
                                       7             =* VBLD which is used in the file system verify process. It produces
                                       8             =* an object module with the name VCAT.
                                       9             =*
                                      10       3.     *
                                      11       4.     * This module is the old VCAT module from the last version of ORVYL
                                      12       5.     * which included the file system rewrite. It is the only module
                                      13       6.     * remaining as all the others were rewritten. FILECAT is a layer
                                      14       7.     * above this module to act as an interface from the file system
                                      15       8.     * rewrite to this catalog handling module. This module has only
                                      16       9.     * a couple of minor changes from VCAT.
                                      17      10.     *
                                      18      11.     *******************************************************************
                                      19      12.     *                                                                 *
                                      20      13.     *     ORVYL/370 - Release IV - Class I - Stanford Proprietary     *
                                      21      14.     *                                                                 *
                                      22      15.     *******************************************************************
-                                     24      17.              HIBAL ,
-000000                00000 046CB  1006      19.     FILEVCAT MODULE TRCNUM=12,ID=VC
                                    1016             +*
                                    1017    02-IDENT +         ENTRY FILEVC
                                    1018             +
 000000 14C6C9D3C5E5C36B            1019    02-IDENT +FILEVC   DC    AL1(20),C'FILEVC,22MAR04,09:45'
                                    1020             +*
-                                   1023      21.              GBLB  &DEBUG,&CHKOFF,&NOBACK
                                    1024      22.     &DEBUG   SETB  1                       THIS IS THE DEBUG PASS
                                    1025      23.     &CHKOFF  SETB  0                       DO EXTRA CHECKS FOR NOW...
                                    1026      24.     &NOBACK  SETB  0                       DO BACKUP I/O FOR NOW...
1FILEVCAT (FILEVC) (09:45) (22MAR04) Definitions                                                                            Page    4
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.45
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   1028      26.              REGS  ,,SR,TR,QR,RQBR,FBR,BR,WAR,RAR,FSBR,SCBR,CTR,WR
                                    1191      27.     *********************************************************************
                                    1192      28.     * VFIL regs statement                                               *
                                    1193      29.     *********************************************************************
-                                   1195      31.              REGS  MIX,IX,,NOD,,,,,CHKR,,,,,,CNT,PTR
                                    1280      32.     *********************************************************************
                                    1281      33.     * DSK POINTS TO THE START OF THE DISK BLOCK IN MEMORY               *
                                    1282      34.     * NOD POINTS TO THE CURRENT NODE                                    *
                                    1283      35.     * IX IS AN INDEX REGISTER                                           *
                                    1284      36.     *********************************************************************
-                                   1286      38.              REGS  ,,DSK,LAS,CUR,,,,,,,,,,NEW,SIZ
                                    1358      39.     *********************************************************************
                                    1359      40.     *                    Disk management regs                           *
                                    1360      41.     * DSK Provides addressability to the disk block DSECT               *
                                    1361      42.     * LAS IS A POINTER TO THE LAST (PREVIOUS) MEMORY BLOCK              *
                                    1362      43.     * CUR IS A POINTER TO THE CURRENT MEMORY BLOCK                      *
                                    1363      44.     * NEW IS A POINTER TO THE NEW MEMORY BLOCK                          *
                                    1364      45.     * SIZ IS THE SIZE OF THE CURRENT BLOCK                              *
                                    1365      46.     *********************************************************************
-                                   1367      48.     *        PRINT OFF                     VCAT MACROS
                                    1368      49.              MACRO ,                        DIRSAV
                                    1369      50.     .********************************************************************
                                    1370      51.     .*   Save (noncontiguous) registers in the RQBL stack.
                                    1371      52.     .* BR    When optionally specified, indicates that this register
                                    1372      53.     .*       is also to be used as a base register.  If the register
                                    1373      54.     .*       is to be saved, it must be in the SYSLIST as well.
                                    1374      55.     .* ENTRY When optionally specified as YES, then &L is set as an
                                    1375      56.     .*       entry point.
                                    1376      57.     .********************************************************************
                                    1377      58.     &L       DIRSAV &BR=NO,&ENTRY=NO
                                    1378      59.              GBLB  &SIMUL
                                    1379      60.     &N       SETA  1
                                    1380      61.     &NILCNT  SETA  0
                                    1381      62.     &NUM     SETA  N'&SYSLIST
                                    1382      63.              AIF   ('&ENTRY' EQ 'NO').NOENT
                                    1383      64.              ENTRY &L
                                    1384      65.     .NOENT   ANOP
                                    1385      66.     &L       LABEL ,
                                    1386      67.     .LOOP    ANOP                           Save loop
                                    1387      68.              AIF   ('&SYSLIST(&N)' EQ '').NILPARM
                                    1388      69.              ST    &SYSLIST(&N),(4*(&N-&NILCNT-1))(,WR)
                                    1389      70.              AGO   .NONILPA
                                    1390      71.     .NILPARM ANOP
                                    1391      72.     &NILCNT  SETA  &NILCNT+1
                                    1392      73.     .NONILPA ANOP
                                    1393      74.              AIF   (&N GE N'&SYSLIST).INCR
                                    1394      75.     &N       SETA  &N+1
                                    1395      76.              AGO   .LOOP
                                    1396      77.     .INCR    ANOP
                                    1397      78.              LA    WR,((&NUM-&NILCNT)*4)(,WR)
1FILEVCAT (FILEVC) (09:45) (22MAR04) Definitions                                                                            Page    5
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.45
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   1398      79.              AIF   ('&BR' EQ 'NO').NOBASR
                                    1399      80.              BASE  &BR
                                    1400      81.     .NOBASR  ANOP
                                    1401      82.              MEND
                                    1402      83.              MACRO ,                        DIREST
                                    1403      84.     .********************************************************************
                                    1404      85.     .*   Restore registers (noncontiguous) from RQBL stack.
                                    1405      86.     .* ADDR  YES = addressability is available to use an ADCON
                                    1406      87.     .*       NO    no addressability for example, loading the
                                    1407      88.     .*             base register
                                    1408      89.     .* REST  Actually restore registers?  If set to NO, then the stack
                                    1409      90.     .*       pointer is decremented, but the specified registers
                                    1410      91.     .*       aren't restored.
                                    1411      92.     .********************************************************************
                                    1412      93.     &L       DIREST &ADDR=YES,&REST=YES
                                    1413      94.     &N       SETA  1
                                    1414      95.     &NUM     SETA  N'&SYSLIST
                                    1415      96.     &L       LABEL ,
                                    1416      97.              AIF   ('&ADDR' NE 'YES').NOADDR
                                    1417      98.              SH    WR,=Y(&NUM*4)
                                    1418      99.              AGO   .ADDR
                                    1419     100.     .NOADDR  ANOP  ,
                                    1420     101.              LA    &SYSLIST(1),&NUM*4
                                    1421     102.              SR    WR,&SYSLIST(1)
                                    1422     103.     .ADDR    ANOP  ,
                                    1423     104.              AIF   ('&REST' EQ 'NO').DECR
                                    1424     105.     .LOOP    ANOP
                                    1425     106.              L     &SYSLIST(&N),(4*(&N-1))(,WR)
                                    1426     107.              AIF   (&N GE N'&SYSLIST).DECR
                                    1427     108.     &N       SETA  &N+1
                                    1428     109.              AGO   .LOOP
                                    1429     110.     .DECR    ANOP
                                    1430     111.              MEND
                                    1431     112.              MACRO ,                        DIRENT
                                    1432     113.     .********************************************************************
                                    1433     114.     .*   Register save macro, which automatically uses the first
                                    1434     115.     .* register of the SYSLIST as a base register, and only saves
                                    1435     116.     .* 2 registers.
                                    1436     117.     .* ENTRY When optionally specified, sets up &L as an entry point.
                                    1437     118.     .********************************************************************
                                    1438     119.     &L       DIRENT &ENTRY=NO
                                    1439     120.     &L       DIRSAV &SYSLIST(1),&SYSLIST(2),BR=&SYSLIST(1),ENTRY=&ENTRY
                                    1440     121.              MEND
                                    1441     122.              MACRO ,                       DREAD
                                    1442     123.     .********************************************************************
                                    1443     124.     .*   Read a catalog block.
                                    1444     125.     .* BLK   Relative block number to read.
                                    1445     126.     .* LOCK  Whether or not the block is to be locked in core.
                                    1446     127.     .* PTR   The suffix of Checkpoint block pointer slots which will be
                                    1447     128.     .*       filled if this parm is specified.
                                    1448     129.     .* TAG   The suffix of Checkpoint tag slot for this block.
                                    1449     130.     .* ERR   Branch location on error.
                                    1450     131.     .********************************************************************
                                    1451     132.     &L       DREAD &BLK,&LOCK=NO,&PTR=NO,&TAG=NO,&ERR=
                                    1452     133.     &L       BLKL  R0,&BLK                 LOAD BLOCK NUMBER
                                    1453     134.              AIF   ('&LOCK' NE 'YES').NOLOCK

                                    1455     136.              AGO   .RES
                                    1456     137.     .NOLOCK  ANOP

-                                   1471     152.              MACRO ,                       DWRITE
                                    1472     153.     .********************************************************************
                                    1473     154.     .*   Write a catalog block.
                                    1474     155.     .* BLK   Relative block number to read.
                                    1475     156.     .* REL   Whether or not the block buffer is to be released after
                                    1476     157.     .*       writing.
                                    1477     158.     .* ERR   Branch location on error.
                                    1478     159.     .********************************************************************
                                    1479     160.     &L       DWRITE &BLK,&REL=YES,&ERR=

                                    1486     167.     .REL     ANOP
                                    1487     168.              LCALL DWRITE
                                    1488     169.     .*                                      No error returns now
                                    1489     170.     *        IF     NZ,&ERR
                                    1490     171.              MEND
-                                   1492     173.              MACRO ,                       DDREAD
                                    1493     174.     .********************************************************************
                                    1494     175.     .*   Read a catalog double write block.
                                    1495     176.     .* DBLK  Double write block number (1..3)

0                                   1561     242.              MACRO ,                       LKINCORE
                                    1562     243.     .********************************************************************
                                    1563     244.     .*   -- LOW LEVEL CATALOG BUFFER MANAGEMENT --
                                    1564     245.     .*   Look for a block in Catalog buffer core.
                                    1565     246.     .* BLK   Catalog block number to look for.
                                    1566     247.     .* CUR   Register which will point to current slot in buffer table.
                                    1567     248.     .* LAS   Register which will point to last slot in buffer table.
                                    1568     249.     .********************************************************************

                                    1570     251.     &L       BLKL  R0,&BLK                 LOAD BLOCK NUMBER

                                    1572     253.             $L     &CUR,(R4)               R4 POINTS TO CUR
                                    1573     254.             $L     &LAS,(R3)               R3 POINTS TO LAST SLOT
                                    1574     255.              MEND

                                    1577     258.     .********************************************************************
                                    1578     259.     .*   -- LOW LEVEL CATALOG BUFFER MANAGEMENT --
                                    1579     260.     .*   Mark current Catalog block as Least Recently Used (LRU)
                                    1580     261.     .* CUR   Current slot in buffer table.
                                    1581     262.     .* LAS   Last slot in buffer table.

                                    1583     264.     &L       LRUBUF &CUR,&LAS

                                    1586     267.             $L     R3,&LAS                 R3 SHOULD POINT TO LAST SLOT
                                    1587     268.              LCALL LRUBUF
                                    1588     269.              MEND

-                                   1645     326.              MACRO ,                       GETNODE
                                    1646     327.     .********************************************************************
                                    1647     328.     .*   Allocate a node from block pool.
                                    1648     329.     .* PTRS  Suffix of the pointer slots in the checkpoint block.
                                    1649     330.     .* DATA  Indicates if the allocation is for an index block or a
                                    1650     331.     .*       data block.  See the GETNODE routine to see the
                                    1651     332.     .*       requirements of this parm.  Must be full specification
                                    1652     333.     .*       (not suffix or prefix of location).
                                    1653     334.     .* LOCK  Should the node be locked in core after allocating it?
                                    1654     335.     .* TAG   Suffix of tag location in checkpoint block if the tag is
                                    1655     336.     .*       to be saved.
                                    1656     337.     .* ERR   Branch location on error.
                                    1657     338.     .********************************************************************
                                    1658     339.     &L       GETNODE &PTRS=,&DATA=NO,&LOCK=NO,&TAG=NO,&ERR=

                                    1661     342.              LA    R14,1
                                    1662     343.              BLKL  R15,&DATA               Load data block number
                                    1663     344.              AGO   .DATA
                                    1664     345.     .NODATA  ANOP
                                    1665     346.              CLEAR R14
                                    1666     347.     .DATA    ANOP

0                                   1667     348.              ACALL GETNODE
                                    1668     349.              IF    NZ,&ERR

                                    1670     351.              STH   R0,CHK&PTRS.B           Block number
                                    1671     352.              STH   R1,CHK&PTRS.N           Node offset

                                    1676     357.              DLOKBUF (R0),ERR=&ERR
                                    1677     358.     .NOLOCK  MEND
-                                   1679     360.              MACRO ,                       RELNODE
                                    1680     361.     .********************************************************************
                                    1681     362.     .*   Release a node and put space back in free pool.
                                    1682     363.     .* RELAD Relative address (in block) of node to be released.
                                    1683     364.     .* LEN   Length of node begin freed.
                                    1684     365.     .* BUFAD Address of buffer that contains the node.

                                    1693     374.              MEND
-                                   1695     376.              MACRO ,                       NTRYMOV
                                    1696     377.     .********************************************************************
                                    1697     378.     .*   Move an entry/entrys from one node to another.
                                    1698     379.     .* SRC   Suffix of source node pointers in checkpoint block.
                                    1699     380.     .* DEST  Suffix of destination node pointers in checkpoint block.
                                    1700     381.     .* DELSRC      Delete entry in source node?  Sets parameter.
                                    1701     382.     .********************************************************************

                                    1703     384.     &L       LABEL ,
                                    1704     385.              AIF   ('&DELSRC' EQ 'YES').DEL
                                    1705     386.              LH    RAR,CHKBDLN
                                    1706     387.              LCR   RAR,RAR
                                    1707     388.              STH   RAR,CHKBDLN
                                    1708     389.     .DEL     ANOP
                                    1709     390.              LH    R1,CHK&SRC.N
                                    1710     391.              AL    R1,CHK&SRC.A
                                    1711     392.              LH    R15,CHK&DEST.N
                                    1712     393.              AL    R15,CHK&DEST.A
                                    1713     394.              ACALL NTRYMOV
                                    1714     395.              MEND

0                                   1773     454.              MACRO ,                       CHKPUSH
                                    1774     455.     .********************************************************************
                                    1775     456.     .*   Push the tree searching stack, leaving addressability in ADDRREG
                                    1776     457.     .* ADDRREG     Register which will point to top of stack.
                                    1777     458.     .* ERR         Branch location on error (stack overflow).
                                    1778     459.     .********************************************************************
                                    1779     460.     &L       CHKPUSH &ADDRREG=,&ERR=
                                    1780     461.              GBLB  &CHKOFF                 Turn off unnecessary checks
                                    1781     462.     &L       LABEL ,
                                    1782     463.              AIF   (&CHKOFF).NOSTOV
                                    1783     464.              INCR  &ADDRREG,CHKSTKP
                                    1784     465.              IF    (&ADDRREG,GT,CCHKSTK),BEGIN
                                    1785     466.              LA    R15,DIRSTOV
                                    1786     467.              BAS   R14,&ERR
                                    1787     468.              END   ,
                                    1788     469.     .NOSTOV  ANOP  ,
                                    1789     470.              MH    &ADDRREG,=Y(L'CHKDSTK)  ADDR TO STACK ENTRY
                                    1790     471.              LA    &ADDRREG,CHKSTAK-L'CHKDSTK(&ADDRREG)
                                    1791     472.              CLEAR CHKSTFLG                INIT ENTRY
                                    1792     473.              MEND
-                                   1794     475.              MACRO ,                       TRESTKAD
                                    1795     476.     .********************************************************************
                                    1796     477.     .*   Tree traversal stack addressability.
                                    1797     478.     .* ADDRREG     Register which will point to top of tree traversal
                                    1798     479.     .*             stack.
                                    1799     480.     .********************************************************************
                                    1800     481.     &L       TRESTKAD &ADDRREG
                                    1801     482.     &L       LH    &ADDRREG,CHKSTKP
                                    1802     483.              MH    &ADDRREG,=Y(L'CHKDSTK)  ADDR TO STACK ENTRY
                                    1803     484.              LA    &ADDRREG,CHKSTAK-L'CHKDSTK(&ADDRREG)
                                    1804     485.              MEND
-                                   1806     487.              MACRO ,                       REGCH
                                    1807     488.     .********************************************************************
                                    1808     489.     .*   Check symbolic registers for equalness.
                                    1809     490.     .* The parameter string is a list of register pairs ie, (R2,SR)
                                    1810     491.     .* which are meant to match.  This will check on assumptions which
                                    1811     492.     .* could be changed by an unknowing change to a REGS statement.
                                    1812     493.     .********************************************************************
                                    1813     494.              REGCH
                                    1814     495.     &N       SETA  1
                                    1815     496.     .REGNEX  AIF   (L'&SYSLIST(&N,1) NE &SYSLIST(&N,2)).REGER
                                    1816     497.     .INCR    AIF   (&N GE N'&SYSLIST).REGX
                                    1817     498.     &N       SETA  &N+1
                                    1818     499.              AGO   .REGNEX
                                    1819     500.     .REGER   ANOP
                                    1820     501.      MNOTE  8,'&SYSLIST(&N,1) is not register &SYSLIST(&N,2)'
                                    1821     502.              AGO   .INCR
                                    1822     503.     .REGX    MEND
                                    1823     504.              MACRO ,                       BLKL
                                    1824     505.     .********************************************************************
                                    1825     506.     .*   Load block pointer into register.  (Checks halfword/fullword)
                                    1826     507.     .* REG   Register to be loaded.
1FILEVCAT (FILEVC) (09:45) (22MAR04) Definitions                                                                            Page   13
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.45
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   1827     508.     .* LOC   Location to load from.
                                    1828     509.     .********************************************************************
                                    1829     510.     &L       BLKL  &REG,&LOC
                                    1830     511.              GBLA  &BL
                                    1831     512.     &OP      SETC  'L'
                                    1832     513.              AIF   (&BL NE 2).LEN4
                                    1833     514.     &OP      SETC  '&OP.H'
                                    1834     515.     .LEN4    ANOP
                                    1835     516.     &L      $L     &REG,&LOC,OP=&OP        GET BLOCK NUMBER
                                    1836     517.              MEND
-                                   1838     519.              MACRO ,                       BUGNTRY
                                    1839     520.     .*  Create an entry point if in debug mode
                                    1840     521.              BUGNTRY &NTRYPT
                                    1841     522.              GBLB  &DEBUG
                                    1842     523.              AIF   (NOT &DEBUG).DONE
                                    1843     524.              ENTRY &NTRYPT
                                    1844     525.     .DONE    MEND
                                    1845     526.     *        PRINT ON
-                                   1847     528.              COPY  PZERO

 000000                00000 00010  3002             =DSKBLK   RECORD BEGIN
                                    3010  1          =*  NOTE: THE SIZE OF A DISK HEADER MUST EVENLY DIVIDE INTO
                                    3011  1          =*        THE SIZE OF A DISK BLOCK.
                                    3012  1          =CDSKLLIM   EQU    8,8,C'N'          MINIMUM ALLOC SIZE IN A BLOCK
                                    3013  1          =*  NOTE: THE MINIMUM ALLOC SIZE IN A BLOCK MUST EVENLY DIVIDE INTO
                                    3014  1          =*        THE SIZE OF A DISK BLOCK.
                                    3015  1          =CDSKNIL    EQU    -1                END OF LIST POINTER
                                    3016  1          =CDSKSERR   EQU    4                 NOT ENOUGH SPACE FOR DSKGET
                                    3017  1          =CDSKINER   EQU    8                 BLOCK NOT INITIALIZED ERROR

0                                   4013     655.     *********************************************************************
                                    4014     656.     * ON ENTRY: R0  = Relative block # to be written                    *
                                    4015     657.     *           IF R15 = 0 Then this block can be freed                 *
                                    4016     658.     *                      Otherwise the block will stay locked in core *

                                    4018     660.     *             Block has been written                                *

0                                   4931     937.     *********************************************************************
                                    4932     938.     * ON ENTRY                                                          *
                                    4933     939.     *       R0 contains the block number to look for                    *
                                    4934     940.     * ON EXIT                                                           *
                                    4935     941.     *       R0 unchanged                                                *
                                    4936     942.     *       IF CC = 0                                                   *
                                    4937     943.     *         R3 points to the last slot                                *
                                    4938     944.     *            IF R3 = 0, the block is the root block                 *
                                    4939     945.     *         R4 points to the current slot                             *
                                    4940     946.     *       IF CC ~ 0                                                   *
                                    4941     947.     *         Block was not found                                       *
                                    4942     948.     *********************************************************************
 00055A                             4943     949.     LKINCORE LABEL ,
 00055A 1BEE                        4945     950.              CLEAR R14                     ASSUME FOUND - UNTIL NOT
 00055C 5900 A064            00064  4949     951.              IF    (R0,EQ,FSBROOTB),BEGIN  ROOT BLOCK?
 000560 4770 753A            0056A  4961             +
 000564 4140 A064            00064  4966  1  952.                LA    R4,FSBROOTB             SLOT ADDRESS
 000568 1B33                        4967  1  953.                CLEAR R3                      | INDICATE ROOT
 00056A                             4971     954.              END   ,                       OF ROOT BLOCK?
 00056A 753E           0056A 00562  4975     955.              ELSE  BEGIN                   NOT ROOT BLOCK
 00056A 47F0 755A            0058A  4980             +
 00056E 4120 0008            00008  4986  1  956.                LA    R2,CFSBPL               INDEX INCREMENT
 000572 5830 A05C            0005C  4987  1  957.                L     R3,FSBBLKTOP            UPPER LIMIT
 000576 4140 A06C            0006C  4988  1  958.                LA    R4,FSBBLK1              STARTING ADDR
 00057A 5900 4000            00000  4989  1  959.     INCORE     C     R0,@R4                  IS THIS THE DESIRED BLOCK?
 00057E 4780 755A            0058A  4990  1  960.                IF    EQUAL,EXIT              BUFFER FOUND IN CORE
 000582 8742 754A            0057A  5004  1  961.                BXLE  R4,R2,INCORE            CONT LOOKING FOR BUF IN CORE
 000586 41E0 0001            00001  5005  1  962.                LA    R14,1                   INDICATE NOT FOUND
 00058A                             5006     963.              END   ,                       OF NOT ROOT BLOCK
 00058A 12EE                        5010     964.              LTR   R14,R14
 00058C 07F9                        5011     965.              BR    RAR

0                                   5013     967.     *********************************************************************
                                    5014     968.     * ON ENTRY                                                          *
                                    5015     969.     *       R3 points to the last slot                                  *
                                    5016     970.     *          IF R3 = 0, it is root, so dont move it                   *
                                    5017     971.     *       R4 points to the current slot                               *
                                    5018     972.     * ON EXIT                                                           *
                                    5019     973.     *       R3 points to current slot (R3 = 0 if root block)            *
                                    5020     974.     *       DSK contains the buffer address (not aligned)               *
                                    5021     975.     *********************************************************************
 00058E                             5022     976.     LRUBUF   LABEL ,
 00058E 5820 4004            00004  5024     977.              L     DSK,@R4+CFSBBL          GET ADDRESS OF BUFFER

 0005B4                             5077     985.              END   ,

1FILEVCAT (FILEVC) (09:45) (22MAR04) Catalog Driver Routines - Entry Look                                                   Page   54
0Current Usings:  (DSKBLK,R2) (RQB,R5) (*,R7) (CHKPNT,R8) (FSB,R10)
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.45
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   5106    1001.     *********************************************************************
                                    5107    1002.     * On entry: RQBLNAME contains the search key                        *
                                    5108    1003.     *             IF R0 = 0: Indicates an account search                *
                                    5109    1004.     *             IF R0 = 4: Indicates a file search                    *
                                    5110    1005.     *           IF R14 = 0: Only return fixed portions of entries       *
                                    5111    1006.     *           IF R14 ~= 0: Variable permits are returned in entry     *
                                    5112    1007.     *             copy.                                                 *
                                    5113    1008.     *             THEN IF R15 ~ 0: Indicates an attempt to modify an    *
                                    5114    1009.     *               entry length (note that this is only valid for      *
                                    5115    1010.     *               a permit-included search)                           *
                                    5116    1011.     * ON RETURN TO CALLER:                                              *
                                    5117    1012.     *      IF CC = 0                                                    *
                                    5118    1013.     *        R1  = Address of the requested entry                       *
                                    5119    1014.     *        R0  = Size of the entry                                    *
                                    5120    1015.     *        RAR = Address to return to after working w/ entry          *
                                    5121    1016.     *      IF CC ~ 0                                                    *
                                    5122    1017.     *        IF R15 =  4, Entry not found                               *
                                    5123    1018.     *        IF R15 = 28, No more room in catalog                       *
                                    5124    1019.     *        No subsequent return                                       *
                                    5125    1020.     * ON SUBSEQUENT RETURN FROM CALLER:                                 *
                                    5126    1021.     *      RAR = Return Address                                         *
                                    5127    1022.     *      IF R15 = 0                                                   *
                                    5128    1023.     *        The entry was not modified, no rewrite needed              *
                                    5129    1024.     *      IF R15 > 0                                                   *
                                    5130    1025.     *        The entry was modified but the size of the entry is the    *
                                    5131    1026.     *          same, so simply rewrite the block                        *
                                    5132    1027.     *      IF R15 < 0                                                   *
                                    5133    1028.     *        The entry was modified and the size was changed.           *
                                    5134    1029.     *        R1  = Address of new entry (in a buffer)                   *
                                    5135    1030.     *        R0  = Size of new entry                                    *
                                    5136    1031.     * ON FINAL RETURN TO CALLER:                                        *
                                    5137    1032.     *      IF CC = 0                                                    *
                                    5138    1033.     *        Action complete                                            *
                                    5139    1034.     *      IF CC ~ 0                                                    *
                                    5140    1035.     *        IF R15 = 16, Invalid entry size                            *
                                    5141    1036.     *        IF R15 = 20, Can't modify entry len w/out MODS mode        *
                                    5142    1037.     *        IF R15 = 28, No more room in catalog                       *
                                    5143    1038.     *********************************************************************
 0005E8                             5144    1039.     CATLOOK  CATENT ,
                                    5147    1040.
 0005E8 4D90 7862            00892  5148    1041.              LCALL CATNAME                 SETUP NAME (NO DOTS & LEN)
 0005EC                             5150    1042.              CLEAR CHKFLGS                 NEW SEARCH
 0005EC D701 801C 801C 0001C 0001C  5156             +
 0005F2 12EE/4780 75E6       00616  5157    1043.              IF    (R14,NZ),BEGIN          SET PERMITS = YES
 0005F8 9620 801C      0001C        5171  1 1044.                SET   CHKFPER                 |
 0005FC 12FF/4780 75E6       00616  5177  1 1045.                IF    (R15,NZ),BEGIN          SET LEN_MOD = YES
 000602 910C A009      00009        5191  2 1046.                  IF    (FSBCATNLM+FSBCATNIN),BEGIN      Inserts Blocked
 000606 4780 75E2            00612  5204  2          +
 00060A 41F0 001C            0001C  5209  3 1047.                    LA    R15,DIRNMR              |
 00060E 4DE0 7AEA            00B1A  5210  3 1048.                    BAS   R14,CATERROR            |
 000612                             5211  2 1049.                  END   ,                       OF Inserts Bloked
 000612 9658 801C      0001C        5215  2 1050.                  SET   CHKFMOD+CHKFINS+CHKFDEL
 000616                             5228  1 1051.                END   ,                       OF SET LEN_MOD = YES
 000616                             5232    1052.              END   ,                       OF SET PERMITS = YES
1FILEVCAT (FILEVC) (09:45) (22MAR04) Catalog Driver Routines - Entry Look                                                   Page   55

+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0000616 4D90 789A            008CA  5236    1053.              LCALL CATSRCH                 LOOK FOR ENTRY
 00061A 4780 75F6            00626  5238    1054.              IF    NZ,BEGIN                ENTRY NOT FOUND
 00061E 41F0 0004            00004  5249  1 1055.                LA    R15,DIRNFER             RETURN CODE - ACCOUNT NOT FOUND
 000622 4DE0 7AEA            00B1A  5250  1 1056.                BAS   R14,CATERROR
 000626                             5251    1057.              END   ,                       OF ENTRY NOT FOUND
 000626 5890 7840/0D99       00870  5255    1058.              ACALL NTRYLOOK
 00062C 4770 7AEA            00B1A  5259    1059.              IF    NZ,CATERROR
 000630 4D90 7B1E            00B4E  5273    1060.              TOCOM ,                       RETURN TO COMMON
 000634 5890 7844/0D99       00874  5277    1061.              ACALL NTRYLAFT                CALL NEXT IN LIST
 00063A 4770 7AEA            00B1A  5281    1062.              IF    NZ,CATERROR
 00063E 47F0 7B26            00B56  5295    1063.              TOCOM SAVE=NO
1FILEVCAT (FILEVC) (09:45) (22MAR04) Catalog Driver Routines - Entry Insert                                                 Page   56
0Current Usings:  (DSKBLK,R2) (RQB,R5) (*,R7) (CHKPNT,R8) (FSB,R10)
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.45
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   5299    1065.     *********************************************************************
                                    5300    1066.     * On entry: RQBLNAME contains the search key                        *
                                    5301    1067.     *             IF R0 = 0: Indicates an account search                *
                                    5302    1068.     *             IF R0 = 4: Indicates a file search                    *
                                    5303    1069.     * ON RETURN TO CALLER:                                              *
                                    5304    1070.     *      IF CC = 0                                                    *
                                    5305    1071.     *        R1  = Address of the requested entry                       *
                                    5306    1072.     *        R0  = Size of the entry space                              *
                                    5307    1073.     *        RAR = Address to return to after working w/ entry          *
                                    5308    1074.     *      IF CC ~ 0                                                    *
                                    5309    1075.     *        IF R15 =  8, Can't insert duplicate entry                  *
                                    5310    1076.     *        IF R15 = 28, No more room in catalog                       *
                                    5311    1077.     * ON SUBSEQUENT RETURN FROM CALLER:                                 *
                                    5312    1078.     *      RAR = Return Address                                         *
                                    5313    1079.     *      R1  = Address of new entry (no change)                       *
                                    5314    1080.     *      R0  = Length of new entry                                    *
                                    5315    1081.     *      Entry data should be formatted properly                      *
                                    5316    1082.     * ON FINAL RETURN TO CALLER:                                        *
                                    5317    1083.     *      IF CC = 0                                                    *
                                    5318    1084.     *        Insert done                                                *
                                    5319    1085.     *      IF CC ~ 0                                                    *
                                    5320    1086.     *        IF R15 = 16, Invalid entry size                            *
                                    5321    1087.     *********************************************************************
 000642                             5322    1088.     CATINS   CATENT ,
 000642 910C A009      00009        5325    1089.              IF    (FSBCATNLM+FSBCATNIN),BEGIN      Inserts Blocked
 000646 4780 7622            00652  5338             +
 00064A 41F0 001C            0001C  5343  1 1090.                LA    R15,DIRNMR              |

0                                   5533    1139.     *********************************************************************
                                    5534    1140.     * On entry to CATLHERE:                                             *
                                    5535    1141.     *               The stack follows path to this entry                *
                                    5536    1142.     *               IX points to the current entry                      *
                                    5537    1143.     *               DSK points to the current buffer                    *
                                    5538    1144.     * On entry to CATLNEXT:                                             *
                                    5539    1145.     *               The stack follows path to the current entry         *
                                    5540    1146.     * For this routine:                                                 *
                                    5541    1147.     *               IX points to the entry                              *
                                    5542    1148.     *               NOD points to the node which the entry is in        *
                                    5543    1149.     *               DSK points to the buffer which the node is in       *
                                    5544    1150.     *               QR points to the current stack entry                *
                                    5545    1151.     *               CHKSEQA contains the buffer pointer                 *
                                    5546    1152.     * Subsequent calls must provide:                                    *
                                    5547    1153.     *               CHKSEQA with the current node's buffer pointer      *
                                    5548    1154.     *               The top of the search stack with the proper ptrs    *
                                    5549    1155.     * On return:                                                        *
                                    5550    1156.     *             IF CC = 0                                             *
                                    5551    1157.     *               R1/R0 contain the loc/len of the index portion of   *
                                    5552    1158.     *                 the next sequential entry.                        *
                                    5553    1159.     *               QR provides stack addressability                    *
                                    5554    1160.     *               DSK points to the current buffer                    *
                                    5555    1161.     *               RQFNNOD indicates if this is first time for this    *
                                    5556    1162.     *                 node in the tree traversal.                       *
                                    5557    1163.     *             IF CC ~ 0                                             *
                                    5558    1164.     *               There are no more entrys in this tree               *
                                    5559    1165.     *********************************************************************
 USING  NODE,R3                     5560    1166.              USING NODE,NOD
 USING  NTRY,R1                     5569    1167.              USING NTRY,IX
 USING  CHKDSTK,R4                  5578    1168.              USING CHKDSTK,QR

0                                   5995    1269.     *********************************************************************
                                    5996    1270.     * On entry: CHKFNAME contains the search key                        *
                                    5997    1271.     *             IF R0 = 0: Indicates an account search                *
                                    5998    1272.     *             IF R0 = 4: Indicates a file search                    *
                                    5999    1273.     *               CHKACCB/N and CHKACSP (traversal stack ptr) set up  *
                                    6000    1274.     * On Exit:      The FSB stack contains a trace of the path to the   *
                                    6001    1275.     *                 current location in the catalog                   *
                                    6002    1276.     *               The CC is set based on the value of R15             *
                                    6003    1277.     *                 IF R15 = 0: The entry was found                   *
                                    6004    1278.     *                   DSK points to the buffer of the current node    *
                                    6005    1279.     *                   NOD points to the entry                         *
                                    6006    1280.     *                 IF R15 > 0: The entry was not found               *
                                    6007    1281.     *                   DSK points to the buffer of the current node    *
                                    6008    1282.     *                   NOD points to the entry which is where the      *
                                    6009    1283.     *                       new entry would be.                         *
                                    6010    1284.     *                 IF R15 < 0: There are no entrys in this tree      *
                                    6011    1285.     *********************************************************************
 0008CA 5090 D000            00000  6012    1286.     CATSRCH  DIRSAV RAR
 0008CE 41D0 D004            00004  6016             +

0Current Usings:  (DSKBLK,R2) (RQB,R5) (*,R7) (CHKPNT,R8) (FSB,R10)

+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   6911    1464.     *********************************************************************
                                    6912    1465.     * On entry: RQBLNAME contains the old search key                    *
                                    6913    1466.     *           RQBLRNAM contains the new search key                    *
                                    6914    1467.     *             IF R0 = 0: Indicates an account search                *
                                    6915    1468.     *             IF R0 = 4: Indicates a file search                    *
                                    6916    1469.     *                 Renaming accounts is not valid.  Neither is       *
                                    6917    1470.     *               renaming files across accounts.  Therefore          *
                                    6918    1471.     *               the first call to rename a file should be CATLOOK   *
                                    6919    1472.     *               for the account entry, and then call CATRENAM       *
                                    6920    1473.     *                 It is assumed that the case of renaming across    *
                                    6921    1474.     *               account boundaries has already been checked on      *
                                    6922    1475.     *               entry.                                              *
                                    6923    1476.     * ON RETURN TO CALLER:                                              *
                                    6924    1477.     *      IF CC = 0                                                    *
                                    6925    1478.     *        Rename is done                                             *
                                    6926    1479.     *      IF CC ~ 0                                                    *
                                    6927    1480.     *        IF R15 =  4, Entry not found                               *
                                    6928    1481.     *        IF R15 =  8, Can't insert duplicate entry                  *
                                    6929    1482.     *        IF R15 = 24, Can't rename accounts                         *
                                    6930    1483.     *        IF R15 = 28, No more room in catalog                       *
                                    6931    1484.     *********************************************************************
 000BD2                             6932    1485.     CATRENAM CATENT ,
 000BD2 0D60                        6935    1486.              BASE  FBR
 USING  *,R6
 000BD4 910C A009      00009        6949    1487.              IF    (FSBCATNLM+FSBCATNIN),BEGIN      Inserts Blocked
 000BD8 4780 6010            00BE4  6962             +
 000BDC 41F0 001C            0001C  6967  1 1488.                LA    R15,DIRNMR              |

 000BE4                             6969    1490.              END   ,                       OF Inserts Blocked

0                                   7472    1623.     *********************************************************************
                                    7473    1624.     *   Sequentially list the whole CATALOG, account and file trees     *
                                    7474    1625.     * On entry: FSB buffers are set up                                  *
                                    7475    1626.     * ON RETURN TO CALLER:                                              *
                                    7476    1627.     *     IF CC = 0                                                     *
                                    7477    1628.     *       R1  = Location of entry                                     *
                                    7478    1629.     *       R0  = Len of entry                                          *
                                    7479    1630.     *       R14 = Type of entry                                         *
                                    7480    1631.     *         0 = Account entry                                         *
                                    7481    1632.     *         4 = File entry                                            *
                                    7482    1633.     *       RQFNNOD indicates whether or not this node is new (ie. the  *
                                    7483    1634.     *         first time encountered on the tree traversal)             *
                                    7484    1635.     *       CHKSEQA/B/N point to the buffer address, block num and node *
                                    7485    1636.     *         offset of the current entry                               *
                                    7486    1637.     *       CHKSEQEA/B/N point to the extended buffer address, block    *
                                    7487    1638.     *         num and node offset of the current entrys extended data   *
                                    7488    1639.     *         if such a field exists                                    *
                                    7489    1640.     *     IF CC ~ 0                                                     *
                                    7490    1641.     *       IF R15 =  8: No more entrys                                 *
                                    7491    1642.     *       IF R15 = 16: No entrys in account tree                      *
                                    7492    1643.     *********************************************************************
                                    7493    1644.     *NEST,1
 000D8C                             7494    1645.     CATSEQ   CATENT ,
 000D8C 0D60                        7497    1646.              BASE  FBR
 DROP   *,R6
 USING  *,R6
                                    7514    1647.     *               Name buffer
 000D8E                             7515    1648.              CLEAR CHKFNAME                LIST ACCOUNTS

0                                   7982    1770.     *********************************************************************
                                    7983    1771.     *   Sequentially list a tree ACCOUNT/FILE                           *
                                    7984    1772.     * On entry: RQBLNAME contains the search key                        *
                                    7985    1773.     *             IF R0 = 0: Indicates an account search                *
                                    7986    1774.     *             IF R0 = 4: Indicates a file search                    *
                                    7987    1775.     * ON RETURN TO CALLER:                                              *
                                    7988    1776.     *      IF CC = 0                                                    *
                                    7989    1777.     *       The RQB is formatted according to the RQFCLP flag           *
                                    7990    1778.     *       RAR contains the return address to obtain the next entry    *
                                    7991    1779.     *      IF CC ~ 0                                                    *
                                    7992    1780.     *       IF R15 =  8: No more entrys                                 *
                                    7993    1781.     *       IF R15 = 16: No entrys in this tree                         *
                                    7994    1782.     *********************************************************************

0                                   8356    1862.     *********************************************************************
                                    8357    1863.     * ON ENTRY: NOD and DSK contain the entry address and the block     *
                                    8358    1864.     *             address in memory of the entry to be examined         *
                                    8359    1865.     *           CHKNTB/N/AD, CHKCURB/N/AD, CHKPARB/N/AD, CHKLFTB/N,     *
                                    8360    1866.     *             CHKRHTB/N, all contain proper pointers to the current *
                                    8361    1867.     *             entry, the current node, its parent, and its left and *
                                    8362    1868.     *             right siblings respectively.                          *
                                    8363    1869.     * ON FINAL EXIT FROM NTRYLAFT:                                      *
                                    8364    1870.     *           Search pointers are still intact                        *

 001156 5860 D000            00000  8697             +
 00115A 5890 D004            00004  8698             +
 00115E 1BFF                        8699    1933.              CLEAR R15                     ALL OK - SET CC
 001160 07F9                        8703    1934.              BR    RAR
                                    8704    1935.     *********************************************************************
                                    8705    1936.     * ON RETURN TO CALLER:                                              *
                                    8706    1937.     *      IF CC = 0                                                    *
                                    8707    1938.     *        R1  = Address of the requested entry                       *
                                    8708    1939.     *        R0  = Size of the entry                                    *
                                    8709    1940.     *        RAR = Address to return to after working w/ entry          *
                                    8710    1941.     *      IF CC ~ 0                                                    *
                                    8711    1942.     *        R14 conatains the PSW at error detection                   *
                                    8712    1943.     *        The 2nd low order byte of R15 indicates the module         *
                                    8713    1944.     *          in which the error occured.                              *
                                    8714    1945.     *        The low order byte of R15 contains the error code for      *
1FILEVCAT (FILEVC) (09:45) (22MAR04) Entry Look                                                                             Page   82
0Current Usings:  (DSKBLK,R2) (NTRY,R3) (RQB,R5) (*,R6) (*,R7) (CHKPNT,R8) (FSB,R10)
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.45
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   8715    1946.     *          that module.                                             *
                                    8716    1947.     *        No subsequent return                                       *
                                    8717    1948.     * ON SUBSEQUENT RETURN FROM CALLER:                                 *
                                    8718    1949.     *      RAR = Return Address                                         *
                                    8719    1950.     *      IF R15 = 0                                                   *
                                    8720    1951.     *        The entry was not modified, no rewrite needed              *
                                    8721    1952.     *      IF R15 > 0                                                   *
                                    8722    1953.     *        The entry was modified but the size of the entry is the    *
                                    8723    1954.     *          same, so simply rewrite the block                        *
                                    8724    1955.     *      IF R15 < 0                                                   *
                                    8725    1956.     *        The entry was modified and the size was changed.           *
                                    8726    1957.     *        R0  = Size of new entry                                    *
                                    8727    1958.     * ON FINAL RETURN TO CALLER:                                        *
                                    8728    1959.     *      IF CC = 0                                                    *
                                    8729    1960.     *        Action complete                                            *
                                    8730    1961.     *********************************************************************

0                                   9668    2122.     *        RAR = Address to return to after working w/ entry          *
                                    9669    2123.     *      IF CC ~ 0                                                    *
                                    9670    2124.     *        R14 conatains the PSW at error detection                   *
                                    9671    2125.     *        The 2nd low order byte of R15 indicates the module         *
                                    9672    2126.     *          in which the error occured.                              *
                                    9673    2127.     *        The low order byte of R15 contains the error code for      *
                                    9674    2128.     *          that module.                                             *
                                    9675    2129.     *        No subsequent return                                       *
                                    9676    2130.     * ON SUBSEQUENT RETURN FROM CALLER:                                 *
                                    9677    2131.     *      RAR = Return Address                                         *
                                    9678    2132.     *      R1  = Address of new entry (no change)                       *
                                    9679    2133.     *      R0  = Size of new entry                                      *

0                                  10155    2225.     *********************************************************************
                                   10156    2226.     * ON ENTRY: CHKNTB/N/AD contain the block, offset, and buffer       *
                                   10157    2227.     *             address of the entry to be deleted                    *
                                   10158    2228.     *           CHKCURB/N/AD contain the block, offset, and buffer      *
                                   10159    2229.     *             address of the node that contains the entry to be     *
                                   10160    2230.     *             deleted                                               *
                                   10161    2231.     *           CHKPARB/N/AD contain the block, offset, and buffer      *
                                   10162    2232.     *             address of the parent of the node that will have      *
                                   10163    2233.     *             the entry deleted from it                             *
                                   10164    2234.     *           NOD points to the entry to be deleted                   *
                                   10165    2235.     *           DSK points to the buffer of the current entry to be     *
                                   10166    2236.     *             deleted                                               *
                                   10167    2237.     *           CHKLFTB/N and CHKRHTB/N contain block and offset and    *
                                   10168    2238.     *             offset pointers of the left and right siblings of the *
                                   10169    2239.     *             node to be deleted                                    *
                                   10170    2240.     * ON RETURN TO CALLER:                                              *
                                   10171    2241.     *      IF CC = 0                                                    *
                                   10172    2242.     *        Delete done                                                *
                                   10173    2243.     *      IF CC ~ 0                                                    *
                                   10174    2244.     *        R14 conatains the PSW at error detection                   *
                                   10175    2245.     *        The 2nd low order byte of R15 indicates the module         *
                                   10176    2246.     *          in which the error occured.                              *
                                   10177    2247.     *        The low order byte of R15 contains the error code for      *
                                   10178    2248.     *          that module.                                             *
                                   10179    2249.     *********************************************************************

 001750 4780 6284            017F2 10885             +
                                   10890  1 2372.     *               If the transaction is a file root delete, then
                                   10891  1 2373.     *             first write the account entry with it's now nil
                                   10892  1 2374.     *             file tree pointer. Then write the entry's now empty
                                   10893  1 2375.     *             node, and finally the entry's modified data extent
                                   10894  1 2376.     *             if it exists.
                                   10895  1 2377.     *               If the transaction is a delete of a non-leaf
                                   10896  1 2378.     *             entry, then write the replacement entry's leaf
                                   10897  1 2379.     *             node, then the deleted entry's node, and finally
                                   10898  1 2380.     *             the deleted entry's modified data extent.  This
                                   10899  1 2381.     *             protects against a duplication of the replacement
                                   10900  1 2382.     *             entry (from the leaf).
                                   10901  1 2383.     *               The above procedures also insure that any entity
                                   10902  1 2384.     *             will not point to an already deleted item.

+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  11293    2447.     *********************************************************************
                                   11294    2448.     * ON ENTRY:                                                         *
                                   11295    2449.     *           R1  = Location of buffer with entry in it. (NEW)        *
                                   11296    2450.     *           R0  = Length of entry in buffer (NEW)                   *
                                   11297    2451.     *               IF R0 = 0, it signifies an entry slot being deleted *
                                   11298    2452.     *               IF R0 < 0, don't change data extent ptrs of new     *
                                   11299    2453.     *                          entry                                    *
                                   11300    2454.     *           R15 = Address at which entry currently starts           *
                                   11301    2455.     *           R14 = Old entry length (index portion)                  *
                                   11302    2456.     *               IF R14 = 0, it signifies a new entry                *
                                   11303    2457.     *               IF R14 < 0, don't change data extent ptrs of old    *
                                   11304    2458.     *                           entry                                   *
                                   11305    2459.     *           CHK2WRA/B/N contain pointers to current node.           *
                                   11306    2460.     *           IF this is other that a simple change entry size (ie    *
                                   11307    2461.     *             insert root, insert entry, delete entry), then        *
                                   11308    2462.     *             CHKITYPE should have been initialized to indicate     *
                                   11309    2463.     *             this.                                                 *
                                   11310    2464.     * ON RETURN:                                                        *
                                   11311    2465.     *           IF CC = 0                                               *
                                   11312    2466.     *             Action complete: Intentions formatted if necessary    *
                                   11313    2467.     *               Space fields in node updated                        *
                                   11314    2468.     *               Rewrites must be done                               *
                                   11315    2469.     *           IF CC ~ 0                                               *
                                   11316    2470.     *             R14 conatains the PSW at error detection              *
                                   11317    2471.     *             The 2nd low order byte of R15 indicates the module    *
                                   11318    2472.     *               in which the error occured.                         *
                                   11319    2473.     *             The low order byte of R15 contains the error code for *
                                   11320    2474.     *               that module.                                        *
                                   11321    2475.     *********************************************************************
 00188A 5060 D000            00000 11322    2476.     NTRYCHG  DIRENT FBR,RAR
 00188E 5090 D004            00004 11327             +
 001892 41D0 D008/0D60       00008 11328             +
