+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  12561    2645.     *********************************************************************
                                   12562    2646.     * ON ENTRY: IF R14 = 0: It's an index node being allocated          *
                                   12563    2647.     *             Length for index node takes up whole block, which is  *
                                   12564    2648.     *             currently the same for account and file nodes.        *
                                   12565    2649.     *           IF R14 ~ 0: It's a data node being allocated.           *
                                   12566    2650.     *             IF R15 >= 0 it indicates that this data block is in   *
                                   12567    2651.     *               memory, and possibly has room for the allocate      *
                                   12568    2652.     *             Length for data node is the amount in CHKBSLN         *
                                   12569    2653.     *             (copy node length) minus the amount that can fit in   *
                                   12570    2654.     *             the index structure, plus space for extended data     *
                                   12571    2655.     *             node overhead.                                        *
                                   12572    2656.     *           CHKFACC indicates whether the request is for an account *
                                   12573    2657.     *             entry or a file entry                                 *
                                   12574    2658.     * ON EXIT:  IF CC = 0:                                              *
                                   12575    2659.     *             DSK = Buffer address of allocated node                *
                                   12576    2660.     *             R0  = Block number of allocated node                  *
                                   12577    2661.     *             R1  = Block offset of allocated node                  *
                                   12578    2662.     *             NOD = Addressability to allocated node                *
                                   12579    2663.     *             IF an index node:                                     *
                                   12580    2664.     *               NODLEN, NODNTNUM, NODSPACE, the NODFACC/NODFLEAF    *
                                   12581    2665.     *                 flags and the last_entry markers are initialized  *
                                   12582    2666.     *             IF a data node:                                       *
                                   12583    2667.     *               NTRYXLEN is initialized                             *
                                   12584    2668.     *           IF CC ~ 0                                               *
                                   12585    2669.     *             R14 conatains the PSW at error detection              *
                                   12586    2670.     *             The 2nd low order byte of R15 indicates the module    *
                                   12587    2671.     *               in which the error occured.                         *
                                   12588    2672.     *             The low order byte of R15 contains the error code for *
                                   12589    2673.     *               that module.                                        *
                                   12590    2674.     *********************************************************************
                                   12591    2675.     *********************************************************************
                                   12592    2676.     *   GETNODE assumes that an account node takes up a whole disk      *
                                   12593    2677.     * block, and so if a block isn't available, tough, it's an error    *
                                   12594    2678.     * on allocation.  Likewise, it assumes that a file node takes up a  *
                                   12595    2679.     * whole disk block, and so if a block isn't available, tough again. *
                                   12596    2680.     *********************************************************************

0                                  13479    2779.     *********************************************************************
                                   13480    2780.     * ON ENTRY: Calling routine must have saved the old free block      *
                                   13481    2781.     *             pointer its own intentions block before calling this  *
                                   13482    2782.     *             routine                                               *
                                   13483    2783.     * ON EXIT:  IF CC = 0                                               *
                                   13484    2784.     *             R0  = Number of allocated block                       *
                                   13485    2785.     *             DSK = Buffer that contains block                      *
                                   13486    2786.     *           IF CC ~ 0                                               *
                                   13487    2787.     *             R14 conatains the PSW at error detection              *
                                   13488    2788.     *             The 2nd low order byte of R15 indicates the module    *
                                   13489    2789.     *               in which the error occured.                         *
                                   13490    2790.     *             The low order byte of R15 contains the error code for *
                                   13491    2791.     *               that module.                                        *
                                   13492    2792.     *********************************************************************

0                                  13618    2817.     *********************************************************************
                                   13619    2818.     * ON ENTRY: R1 Must contain the block buffer start address          *
                                   13620    2819.     *           R15 Must contain the address (relative to the           *
                                   13621    2820.     *                    start of the block) of the area to be linked   *
                                   13622    2821.     *           R0 Must contain size of area to be linked               *
                                   13623    2822.     *           CHKFACC indicates whether the request is for an account *
                                   13624    2823.     *             node or a file node                                   *
                                   13625    2824.     * ON EXIT:  DSK = Block buffer start address                        *
                                   13626    2825.     *           IF CC = 0                                               *
                                   13627    2826.     *             Specified node is released, and corresponding space   *
                                   13628    2827.     *               management chains are updated                       *
                                   13629    2828.     *           IF CC ~ 0                                               *
                                   13630    2829.     *             R14 contains the PSW at error detection               *
                                   13631    2830.     *             The 2nd low order byte of R15 indicates the module    *
                                   13632    2831.     *               in which the error occured.                         *
                                   13633    2832.     *             The low order byte of R15 contains the error code for *
                                   13634    2833.     *               that module.                                        *
                                   13635    2834.     *********************************************************************

 001EA2                            13679    2840.              END   ,                       OF DSKFREE ERROR

 001EB2 4710 605A            01EEA 13718  1          +

+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  14022    2888.     *********************************************************************
                                   14023    2889.     * ON ENTRY:                                                         *
                                   14024    2890.     *   NOD, DSK (registers), CHKCURA/B/N and CHKPARA/B/N point to      *
                                   14025    2891.     *    the node that caused call and its parent respectively          *
                                   14026    2892.     * DURING PROCEDURE:                                                 *
                                   14027    2893.     *   CHKNODN contains the number of nodes to work with               *
                                   14028    2894.     *   CHKSPAC contains the number of free bytes within those nodes    *
                                   14029    2895.     * ON EXIT:                                                          *
                                   14030    2896.     *   IF R15 = 0                                                      *
                                   14031    2897.     *     FSB pointers point to the parent of the original current      *
                                   14032    2898.     *       node as the point to continue searching                     *
                                   14033    2899.     *     DSK (register) points to the parent's (now current) buf addr  *
                                   14034    2900.     *     NOD (register) points to the parent (now current) node        *
                                   14035    2901.     *   IF R15 ~ 0                                                      *
                                   14036    2902.     *     R14 conatains the PSW at error detection                      *
                                   14037    2903.     *     The 2nd low order byte of R15 indicates the module            *
                                   14038    2904.     *       in which the error occured.                                 *
                                   14039    2905.     *     The low order byte of R15 contains the error code for         *
                                   14040    2906.     *       that module.                                                *
                                   14041    2907.     *     If the error is not catastrophic, (like no-more-room), then   *
                                   14042    2908.     *       the blocks in the buffer space should be invalidated to     *
                                   14043    2909.     *       indicate that they no longer contain the most recent and    *
                                   14044    2910.     *       correct copy of those blocks.  Then the routines may        *
                                   14045    2911.     *       continue to process other requests                          *
                                   14046    2912.     *********************************************************************
 USING  NODE,R3                    14047    2913.              USING NODE,NOD
 001FA0 5060 D000            00000 14056    2914.     NODBAL   DIRENT FBR,RAR                BALANCE 1 TO 3 NODES
 001FA4 5090 D004            00004 14061             +
 001FA8 41D0 D008/0D60       00008 14062             +
 001FAE D205 8114 800E 00114 0000E 14080    2915.              MVC   CHKICHAN,CHKCHAIN       OLD CHAIN POINTERS
 DROP   *,R6

 001FCE 4830 8036            00036 14120    2921.              LH    NOD,CHKCURN             ADDR TO CURRENT NODE

0                                  14608    3023.     *********************************************************************
                                   14609    3024.     *   Space needed to avoid split                                     *
                                   14610    3025.     *   3 nodes: if central space needed is <= min space of entry       *
                                   14611    3026.     *       needed space: (5*max_entry)+(5*max_diff)-2                  *
                                   14612    3027.     *   3 nodes: if central space needed is > min space of entry        *
                                   14613    3028.     *       needed space: (6*max_entry)+(6*max_diff)-(2*min)-2          *
                                   14614    3029.     *   2 nodes: if central space needed is <= min space of entry       *

0                                  17866    3636.     *********************************************************************
                                   17867    3637.     * NBBAL - Balance among given nodes                                 *
                                   17868    3638.     * ON ENTRY: CHKNODN indicates how many nodes are in the balance     *
                                   17869    3639.     *           CHKSPAC indicates how much space is in these nodes      *
                                   17870    3640.     *           CHKFLFTU and CHKFRHTU flags indicate if the             *
                                   17871    3641.     *             respective left and right nodes are in the balance    *
                                   17872    3642.     *           The left, current, right, and parent pointers are       *
                                   17873    3643.     *             assumed to be initialized and the nodes in memory     *
                                   17874    3644.     *           This routine should be called only if there is enough   *
                                   17875    3645.     *             room to avoid a collapse or split                     *
                                   17876    3646.     * ON EXIT:  The balance is complete among the given nodes.          *
                                   17877    3647.     *********************************************************************
                                   17878    3648.     *NEST,1
 USING  NODE,R3                    17879    3649.              USING NODE,NOD
 USING  NTRY,R1                    17888    3650.              USING NTRY,IX

 002D98 41D0 D008/0D60       00008 17903             +

 DROP   *,R6
 USING  *,R6

                                   17934    3655.     *        (Total - possible_increase_from_parent)/#_nodes = IDEAL AVG
                                   17935    3656.     *        Poss_incr_from_parent = par_lengths - (min_len * #_dividing _
                                   17936    3657.     *      parents)

0                                  20350    4143.     *********************************************************************
                                   20351    4144.     * ON ENTRY:                                                         *
                                   20352    4145.     *           R1  = source node address in mem                        *
                                   20353    4146.     *           R15 = destination node address in mem                   *
                                   20354    4147.     *           CHKBSAD = Source location of move                       *
                                   20355    4148.     *           CHKBSLN = Source length of move                         *
                                   20356    4149.     *               IF CHKBSLN < 0, don't delete source in node         *
                                   20357    4150.     *           CHKBDAD = Destination location of move                  *
                                   20358    4151.     * ON RETURN:                                                        *
                                   20359    4152.     *           IF CC = 0                                               *
                                   20360    4153.     *             Action complete:                                      *
                                   20361    4154.     *               Space fields of nodes have been updated             *
                                   20362    4155.     *               Number of entry counts also updated                 *
                                   20363    4156.     *           IF CC ~ 0                                               *
                                   20364    4157.     *             R14 conatains the PSW at error detection              *
                                   20365    4158.     *             The 2nd low order byte of R15 indicates the module    *
                                   20366    4159.     *               in which the error occured.                         *
                                   20367    4160.     *             The low order byte of R15 contains the error code for *
                                   20368    4161.     *               that module.                                        *
                                   20369    4162.     *********************************************************************

                                   21050    4319.     * ON ENTRY:                                                         *

                                   21052    4321.     *        R0 = SIZE OF REQUEST FOR CORE                              *
                                   21053    4322.     *          IF R0 > 0 : USE BEST FIT ALGORITHM                       *
                                   21054    4323.     *          IF R0 < 0 : USE FIRST FIT ALGORITHM                      *
                                   21055    4324.     *   DSKGET must be passed an initialized block.                     *
                                   21056    4325.     * ON RETURN:                                                        *
                                   21057    4326.     *        DSK = BLOCK BUFFER START ADDRESS                           *

                                   21060    4329.     *          R0  = LENGTH OF ALLOCATE                                 *
                                   21061    4330.     *          R14 = AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE SPACE LEFT                     *
                                   21062    4331.     *        CC ~ 0:                                                    *

0                                  21500    4427.     *********************************************************************
                                   21501    4428.     * ON ENTRY: R1 MUST CONTAIN THE BLOCK BUFFER START ADDRESS          *
                                   21502    4429.     *           R15 MUST CONTAIN THE ADDRESS (RELATIVE TO THE           *
                                   21503    4430.     *                    START OF THE BLOCK) OF THE AREA TO BE LINKED   *
                                   21504    4431.     *           R0 MUST CONTAIN SIZE OF AREA TO BE LINKED               *
                                   21505    4432.     * ON EXIT:                                                          *
                                   21506    4433.     *          DSK = BLOCK BUFFER START ADDRESS                         *
                                   21507    4434.     *          CC = 0                                                   *
                                   21508    4435.     *            R1 POINTS TO LINKED BLOCK (RELATIVE TO START OF BLOCK) *
                                   21509    4436.     *            R14 CONTAINS FREE SPACE NOW ON BLOCK                   *
                                   21510    4437.     *          CC ~ 0                                                   *
                                   21511    4438.     *            R14 = PSW @ ERROR DETECTION                            *
                                   21512    4439.     *            IF R15 = 4,  LENGTH ERROR                              *
                                   21513    4440.     *            IF R15 = 8,  ADDRESS ERROR                             *
                                   21514    4441.     *            IF R15 = 12, OVERLAP ERROR                             *
                                   21515    4442.     *********************************************************************

0                                  22226    4595.     *********************************************************************
                                   22227    4596.     *   Note:  Of the 4 minimum rotating buffers used in VCAT, one is   *
                                   22228    4597.     * locked in core for a checkpoint copy during 1st level intentions. *
                                   22229    4598.     * This allows lower level routines to work with a checkpoint copy   *
                                   22230    4599.     * and yet not permanently alter block counts, chain pointers etc.   *
                                   22231    4600.     * Currently the only 1st level recovery routine to call NODBAL      *
                                   22232    4601.     * is the Root Split recovery operation and it uses only 3           *
                                   22233    4602.     * buffers (1 for root, and 2 offspring).                            *
                                   22234    4603.     *   If other 1st level checkpoint routines change, this must be     *
                                   22235    4604.     * taken into account, or else there is the possibility of a ABORT   *
                                   22236    4605.     * CATIOS, when the buffer management routines run out of I/O space. *
                                   22237    4606.     *********************************************************************
 003B54                            22238    4607.     CATREC   CATENT ,
 003B54 0D60                       22241    4608.              BASE  FBR

 USING  *,R6

                                   22865  2 4719.     *               allowed in an index node, the NTRYCHG routine won't
                                   22866  2 4720.     *               reallocate a new extended data block, which has
                                   22867  2 4721.     *               already been written.  This and the index pointer

                                   24423  1 4938.     *                 By making the copy length at most the max length
                                   24424  1 4939.     *               allowed in an index node, the NTRYCHG routine won't
                                   24425  1 4940.     *               reallocate a new extended data block, which has
                                   24426  1 4941.     *               already been written.  This and the index pointer
                                   24427  1 4942.     *               parms on the NTRYCHG call are important for pointer
                                   24428  1 4943.     *               integrity.
